titleStmt.title: William S. Watwood to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2422

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Roaring Spring Trigg County Ky
Febuary 2nd 1861
To the
Hon Beriah Magoffin

Dear Sir Some months ago I resighned my commission as a Justice of the peace for this district with the intention of moving from the county Since circumstances have caused me to settle here again permanently and It seems to be the wish of the neighborhood that I shall again act as a Justice of the peace of this district to which arrangement I have consented provided you will reappoint me & send the commission
We the undersighned fully concur in the above representation of W S Watwood Esq & hope that he may be reappointed

Jno J Rouch
L. U. Landrum
Jno. C. Whitlock
Thos. S. Campbell
Wm Richards
W. H. Malone
Joseph,, Hite

Trigg Co
J. P.
Dist No 4
Wm. S. Watwood
